open_source.name: howard
open_source.headline: An unofficial client library for the Chicago Transit Authority's Train Tracker API

open_source.name: carpenter
open_source.headline: A library to set up database models with test data
longdesc: Carpenter is a PHP library for setting up database fixtures, heavily inspired by FactoryGirl.  It is storage-agnostic and is easy to plug in to any ORM or ODM.

open_source.name: vagrant-php-template
open_source.headline: A template for bootstrapping PHP projects with Vagrant
longdesc: Using Vagrant, VirtualBox, and Salt, this template allows you to quickly spin up a development machine for PHP applications.

open_source.name: php-finance
open_source.headline: Proof-of-Concept PHP Extension
longdesc: php-finance is a proof-of-concept PHP extension to add financial calculation functions, such as interest rate functions, present and future value, etc.  The primary purpose of this project is for me to learn how to build PHP extensions.

open_source.name: Lore
open_source.headline: Object-Oriented LDAP in PHP
longdesc: Lore is a PHP library that takes the pain out of working with LDAP.  It was born out of my work for Orlando 2018, but never finished.

other.name: My dotfiles
other.description: Various configuration files that make my life easier

other.name: revcat.php
other.description: A command line utility for parsing Subversion logs and generating merge commands

other.name: mod_reptile
other.description: A lesson on sandbox security, courtesy of Apache's mod_substitute

presentations.title: Red Light Green Light
presentations.description: This presentation serves as an introduction to unit testing and test driven development.  It covers basic principles of unit testing that can be applied to any language and testing framework, as well as the benefits of test-driven development.
